a cosy relaxing game with surprisingly satisfying if a little on the easy side combat the story develops at just the right pace offering a wry commentary on touristy commercialisation  my main gripe is that snowboard is so much fun to ride i want to use it all the time in every biome

i started this game just expecting a fun zeldalike but got so much more  its a lot of fun to explore the village and get to know the characters  even the ones i found ridiculous and annoying grew on me over time thanks to the concise and clever writing all well balanced with fun dungeons and very solid rpg mechanics on top of that the main story moves at a steady pace with surprisingly deep commentary on the tourism industry  loved it a lot

interesting little adventure with rpg elements puzzles simple enough so even i was able to solve them pleasant music cartoonish but stylish graphics good optimization 60 fps on the steam deck are reachable and now with tasty discounts too theres some global story and stories of each npc but i didnt find them interesting so skipped most for less than usd 10 with discount in my region i can recommend it for sure

this is a hidden gem of a game feels very zelda inspired puzzles could be harder but they are solid the combat system is pretty good and made more interesting because your magical powers differs between the realms  the story and interactions with people is not my style maybe im to old for the influencervibe enters actually good games  if you can ignore the teenage feeling of the story and rpg elements to enjoy some great puzzles combat and exploration this is for you
